Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can clearly and accurately draw a land habitat and a water habitat, showing distinct features of each environment.
The student can include a variety of plants in each habitat, such as trees and grasses in the land habitat and aquatic plants in the water habitat.
The student can represent a wide range of animals in both habitats, illustrating differences such as lizards and squirrels on land and fish and amphibians in water.
The student can effectively show how the living things in each habitat are different, highlighting adaptations specific to land or water environments.
The student can observe and depict patterns in the variety of plants and animals, demonstrating an understanding of biodiversity across habitats.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally miss labeling a specific plant or animal, though this doesn't detract from the overall understanding.
The student might neglect to illustrate less visible or smaller organisms specifically, such as insects or microorganisms, though these are typically understood to be present in varied habitats.
